greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Möbius transform of A323244, the deficiency of A156552(n).
comment: The first eleven zeros occur at n = 1, 15, 16, 40, 96, 119, 120, 160, 893, 2464, 6731. There are 3091 negative terms among the first 10000 terms.
Applying this function to the divisors of the first four terms of A324201 reveals the following pattern:
A324201(n) divisors                             a(n) applied       Sum of positive
The positive and negative terms seem to alternate, and the fourth term (from case n=125 onward) is always 4. See also array A329637.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (based on Hans Havermann's factorization of A156552)
